text: The Boston Navy Yard was one of the oldest shipbuilding places in the United States Navy. It was first called the Charlestown Navy Yard and later Boston Naval Shipyard. It was started in 1801. It was officially closed as an active naval yard on July 1, 1974. The USS Constitution is still docked there. The USS Cassin Young, a World War II-era destroyer, is there and is a museum ship. ==References== ==Other websites== *info Category:Naval transport Category:National Historic Landmarks of the United States Category:Buildings and structures in Massachusetts Category:1800 establishments in the United States Category:18th-century establishments in Massachusetts
title: Boston Navy Yard
